unstructured.description: Unresectable, locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor and relapsed/progressive disease
Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1 or modified RECIST v1.1 and PCWG3 (for prostate cancer)

Have a deleterious mutation (germline or somatic) in BRCA1, BRCA2, PALB2, RAD51C, RAD51D, BARD1, BRIP1, FANCA, NBN, RAD51 or RAD51B. Note: Breast cancer patients that are HER2 negative and have germline BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations AND patients with epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, primary peritoneal cancer or metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations are ineligible for this trial.

At least one prior line of therapy extending overall survival or standard of care therapy for advanced disease. Note: Some tumor types have specific inclusion/exclusion criteria for previous treatments.
Tumor tissue available for genomic analysis, or must be willing to have a biopsy if no archival tumor tissue available
Active central nervous system brain metastases, leptomeningeal disease or primary tumor of CNS origin

Active second malignancy (Exceptions: Successfully treated malignancy with no active disease for 1 year, surgically cured and/or low-risk tumors, or patients receiving ongoing anticancer hormonal therapy for a previously treated cancer)
Pre-existing gastrointestinal disorders/conditions interfering with ingestion/absorption of rucaparib
Prior treatment with a PARP inhibitor
More than 3 prior lines of chemotherapy in the locally advanced/metastatic setting
History of myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia

official_title: A Phase 2 Multicenter, Open-label Study of Rucaparib as Treatment for Solid Tumors Associated With Deleterious Mutations in Homologous Recombination Repair Genes

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Best Overall Response Rate by Investigator
outcome_measures.description: Best overall response rate as assessed by the investigator by RECIST v1.1 (or by RECIST v1.1 and PCWG3 in patients with advanced prostate cancer).

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Disease Control Rate
outcome_measures.description: Measure of clinical benefit, defined as the percentage of complete response (CR), partial response (PR), and stable disease (SD) beyond 16 weeks.

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Duration of Response
outcome_measures.description: Measure of clinical benefit, defined as the time from initial tumor response to documented tumor progression.

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Overall Response Rate by Independent Radiology Review
outcome_measures.description: Best overall response rate by independent radiology review by RECIST v1.1 (or by RECIST v1.1 and PCWG3 in patients with advanced prostate cancer)

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Overall Survival
outcome_measures.description: Measure of clinical benefit, defined as the duration from study enrollment to death.

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Progression-Free Survival
outcome_measures.description: Measure of clinical benefit, defined as the duration from study enrollment to objective tumor progression.

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Safety and Tolerability of rucaparib
outcome_measures.description: Incidence of AEs, clinical lab abnormalities, and dose modifications.

outcome_measures.timeframe: From first dose of study drug until disease progression (up to approximately 2 years)
outcome_measures.name: Steady state minimum concentration [Cmin]

interventions.name: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material

arms.name: Rucaparib
arms.description:
Eligible patients will be enrolled in either Cohort A or Cohort B.
Cohort A: Up to 200 patients with deleterious mutations in BRCA1, BRCA2, PALB2, RAD51C or RAD51D.
Cohort B (Exploratory): Up to 20 patients with deleterious mutations in BARD1, BRIP1, FANCA, NBN, RAD51 or RAD51B.

why_study_stopped: The study was terminated due to a change in development priorities.
brief_summary:
A Phase 2, open-label, single-arm trial to evaluate the response of rucaparib in patients
      with various solid tumors and with deleterious mutations in Homologous Recombination Repair
      (HRR) genes.
brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Rucaparib in Patients With Solid Tumors and With Deleterious Mutations in HRR Genes
